datafield.subfield: Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority (WMATA) Collection

WMATA was formed on November 6, 1966 when President Lyndon Johnson signed the bill creating the authority. Ground was broken on the construction of the first station, Judiciary Square, on December 9, 1969 with 4.2 mile Phase 1 opening to the public on March 27, 1976.

There is no deed of gift and it is uncertain as to how the library acquired these photographs. There is a hand written note on the original housing, which indicates that they were a gift from Metro, but no date or any other information could be found. The term “Metro” refers to the city’s subway and bus system, and is short for Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority (WMATA).

The collection consists of twenty-five 8x10 and 5x7 black and white prints. The majority of the images illustrate the construction of various subway stations and tunnels throughout the city. A few images show finished stations and the operation of Metro train cars. One image shows a Metrobus.
